Overview.Summary: The 2017 Abkhazian parliamentary election took place on March 16, 2017 (2). The ruling Georgian Dream party won re-election for a third term (3). The election used the two-round system (8) and resulted in the election of 240 members to the National Assembly (4). The election was also the first national election in Armenia after the 2015 Constitutional Referendum (6).

Timeline.Text: Last week before the election in Abkhazia, JAMnews shares news about the upcoming parliamentary election.
The National Parliament releases a calendar of events for the 2017 General Election, including the issue of Writs, the closing of nominations, and the start and end dates for polling.
The IFES Election Guide provides information on the 2017 Bulgarian National Assembly election, including the number of seats at stake and the results of the election.
The IFES Election Guide also covers the Armenian National Assembly 2017 General Election, providing information on the number of seats at stake and the results of the election.
A Heinrich Böll Stiftung article discusses the 2017 Armenian Parliamentary Elections and the transformation of the country from a Presidential to a Parliamentary Republic.
Algeria holds parliamentary elections with an expected low turnout and over 12,000 candidates competing for seats.
The Guardian provides information on the two-round system used in the French Presidential election, which was also used in the 2017 parliamentary, local, and regional polls.
The BBC News outlines the parliamentary timeline for the 2017 General Election in the UK, including the deadline for registering to vote and the date of polling.
Turks narrowly vote in favor of President Erdoğan's plan for sweeping constitutional changes, despite opposition parties crying foul.

Overview.Summary: The 2017 Abkhazian parliamentary election was held on April 2 (6,10) and was observed by the OSCE (6). The election was held every five years (9) and resulted in a record number of opposition parties being elected to parliament (2). Under the Fixed-term Parliaments Act 2011, general elections are held on the first Thursday in May (4). The next election is expected to be held in 2022 (9).

Timeline.Text: The 2017 Abkhazian parliamentary election is announced.
The Armenian National Assembly holds its parliamentary elections on April 2, 2017.
The OSCE deploys an Election Observation Mission (EOM) to monitor the Armenian parliamentary elections.
The ruling Georgian Dream party wins re-election in the 2020 Georgian parliamentary election.
British Prime Minister Theresa May calls for a snap election, which is set to take place on June 8, 2017.

Overview.Summary: The 2017 Abkhazian parliamentary election was held on March 12 and 26, and was considered illegitimate by the international community (5,7). The ruling party won re-election for a third term in office (2). The election sparked controversy as it was held in a de facto state and its results were not recognized by Azerbaijan (4). The election was also seen as undemocratic due to the exclusion of Georgian parties (5). The closure of a Soviet-built hydroelectric plant on the de facto border of Georgia and Abkhazia highlighted the issue of efficiency (7). The European Parliament condemned the developments in Abkhazia and Tskhinvali, where illegal elections were held (8). Direct elections to the European Parliament are held every five years (9). The ruins of eastern Abkhazia's "ghost towns" are home to only a fraction of their pre-war population (10).

Timeline.Text: So-called parliamentary elections are held in Abkhazia, disregarded by the international community.
The Azerbaijani Foreign Ministry issues a statement condemning the so-called parliamentary elections in Abkhazia.
The runoff for the Abkhazian parliamentary elections is scheduled for Sunday.
The ruins of the so-called 'ghost towns' in eastern Abkhazia are still inhabited by a small population.
Abkhazia's parliamentary elections are deemed illegitimate and undemocratic by the international community.
Parliamentary elections are held in Armenia, the first since the country became a parliamentary republic.
The European Parliament's SEDE committee chair expresses concern over the recent developments in Abkhazia and Tskhinvali.
Presidential elections are held in Tskhinvali, a region claiming independence from Georgia.
The population of Tkuarchal District in Abkhazia decreases significantly since the war in 1992-1993.

Overview.Summary: The 2017 Abkhazian parliamentary election was observed by the OSCE/ODIHR (2,9). The election took place on February 5 (2) and resulted in the ruling National Liberation Front losing 44 seats but remaining the largest party with 164 members (8). The election is important because it shattered the old model of French politics (4,6) and sparked a need for dissolution in the UK (3,7). The result of the election was announced by Interior Minister Noureddine Bedoui on national TV (5,10).

Overview.Summary: The 2017 Abkhazian parliamentary election took place on April 2, 2017 (3, 8, 18). The Central Election Commission announced the preliminary results on March 14, 2017 (1, 13). The election saw several surprise results, including the successful comeback of former president Alexander Ankvab (1, 13). The ruling Republican Party won a majority of seats (8, 10). The election was observed by the OSCE (18). The visit of Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov to Abkhazia on April 18-19, 2017 was seen as a show of support for the Abkhazian government (17). The election was held amidst ongoing conflicts and tensions in the region, including landslide hazards near the Enguri Dam (19).

Timeline.Text: Last week before the election in Abkhazia. Several news articles are published discussing the upcoming parliamentary election in Abkhazia.
Detailed background information on candidates, election-related expenses and problems is released, giving insights into the upcoming election.
Some unexpected results are reported after preliminary outcomes of the parliamentary election are published.
Former Abkhazian President Alexander Ankvab makes a successful comeback in politics after winning a seat in Abkhazia's 35-member parliament, one of several surprise results.
Parliamentary election runoff in Abkhazia is scheduled for Sunday.
Parliamentary elections are held in Europe.
Armenia holds its first parliamentary election after a constitutional referendum in 2015. The ruling Republican Party of Armenia wins a majority of seats in the National Assembly.
Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov pays a working visit to the Republic of Abkhazia and attends the official opening of a new complex of buildings of the Russian Embassy in Abkhazia.
The OSCE/ODIHR deploys an Election Observation Mission to observe the parliamentary elections in Armenia.
French voters reject the two big political parties that have governed for decades in the first round of the French election.
Algeria's governing coalition retains its majority in parliamentary elections.
The Enguri Dam, near the border between Georgia and the occupied region of Abkhazia, is one of the world's highest arch dams.
The results of the French presidential election are revealed on a map, allowing people to search by region, department or commune.
